Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: Do i read and understand this correct?  With the CC technology of Komodo i can design any boolean circuit with whatever logical gates i want that means fully touring complete??

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it allows to add new consensus rules and as long as you have a boolean evaluator it will work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: many example CC, each about 1000 lines of code that extend the normal consensus rules with a new vout type

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when spent the vout evalcode validation must be passed and return true. the C/C++ code that executes on validation can do whatever code inside the daemon can do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are working on gateways CC that will tokenize external coins and it is almost fully decentralized, also 1:1 sidechains are in the near term goals so legacy coins can continue to trade on exchangs, but to use with CC you swap it for the sidechain

Content: gateways CC will connect the different CC chains?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: The CC already are calling internal functions that can determine notarization happened or not, we do need to implement that, but it wont be hard

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: gateways CC would allow to tokenize BTC onchain of the CC chain. then you do CC things to the BTC tokens and when done can redeem it back to a BTC address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: theoretically any bitcoin protocol coin can be gatewayed onchain. it is an improved version of multigateway from 4 years ago

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: I believe i understand the idea. WIth gateway CC i can make my CC chain with my new consensus. Now i want to trade and do things on the real chain. I can use gateway CC to turn my CC token into real bitcoin like a swap beacuse the system accepts it as a peg.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC in general allows you to create a new consensus rule

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: Improved version of multigateway from 4 years ago.... i dont know the multigateway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: gateways CC in specific has the ruleset so that externally deposited BTC is converted into onchain tokens (from assets CC), the other ruleset is that the BTC tokens that are redeemed are sent to the designated BTC address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so using the gateways CC and a set of BTC custodian nodes, you can get a BTC equivalent token onchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this then allows betting or whatever with the BTC equivalent token, ie. giving all the powers of CC to the BTC

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: Now understood! Thanks for explanation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the various CC are able to use each other so can be combined, the gateways CC uses the oracles CC to get the merkle data from BTC, that way it can validate a BTC deposit was actually made, using only onchain data

Content: really, your imagination is the only thing that limits what a CC can do

Content: best part is with very small amount of code you can test a live chain with the new consensus
